SENT.plain: Chloramphenicol-induced aplastic anemia is well described in the literature following oral use of the drug
Here we describe the first case we are aware of in which chloramphenicol eye ointment resulted in severe aplastic anemia and, subsequently, death
At least two cases of marrow hypoplasia following use of chloramphenicol eyedrops have been described previously in the literature
The absorption route, its possible relation to the pathogenesis of aplastic anemia, and the two types of marrow toxicity associated with chloramphenicol are reviewed
This case emphasizes the necessity for the same careful consideration for the use of topical preparations that one affords the use of parenterally and orally administered medications
